security_audit.summary: This skill is pure documentation describing MCP tool interfaces for Proxmox backup operations. All 20 static findings are false positives from pattern matching on documentation text and JSON metadata. No executable code, network calls, or security risks exist.

content.user_title: Manage Proxmox backups and disaster recovery
content.value_statement: Protect your Proxmox infrastructure from data loss with automated backup management. Create backups, restore VMs and containers, and test recovery procedures using natural language commands.
actual_capabilities: Create and manage VM and container backups in Proxmox environments
Restore VMs and containers from existing backup files
Create and restore snapshots for point-in-time recovery operations
Monitor backup completion status and track storage usage metrics
Generate disaster recovery documentation and compliance reports
Plan backup retention policies and test recovery procedures
limitations: Requires Proxmox VE 7.x or 8.x with MCP server properly configured
Cannot perform backups without adequate storage space and permissions
Recovery speed depends on storage performance and backup file size
Does not directly integrate with cloud backup services without additional MCP tools

use_cases.description: Schedule and manage backups for multiple VMs and containers across Proxmox clusters with retention policies

use_cases.title: Test disaster recovery procedures
use_cases.description: Verify backup integrity and practice recovery workflows before real emergencies occur

use_cases.title: Generate audit-ready reports
use_cases.description: Create documentation of backup status and disaster recovery readiness for compliance requirements

prompt_templates.prompt: Create a backup of VM 100 to storage location local-lvm

prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the status of all backups created in the last 7 days with storage usage

prompt_templates.title: Restore from backup
prompt_templates.prompt: Restore VM 200 from the backup created on January 15 and verify functionality

prompt_templates.title: Generate DR report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a comprehensive disaster recovery test report for all critical VMs including RTO and RPO analysis

output_examples.input: Create a backup of VM 100 and show me available storage
output: Storage: local-lvm shows 120GB used of 500GB total capacity
Estimated completion time: 15 minutes based on VM size
Recommendation: Consider offsite replication for critical production data

output_examples.input: Show me all backups from last week and identify any failures
output: VM 200: 1 backup failed due to insufficient storage space
Action needed: Investigate VM 200 backup failure and increase storage allocation

output_examples.input: Generate a disaster recovery test plan for critical systems
output: DR Test Plan for 5 critical systems identified
Recovery Time Objective (RTO): 2 hours based on current backup size
Recovery Point Objective (RPO): 24 hours with daily backup schedule
Test procedure: Restore to isolated environment, verify functionality, document results
Next recommended test date: Within 30 days to maintain compliance readiness

best_practices: Follow the 3-2-1 backup rule: maintain 3 copies on 2 different media types with 1 offsite
Test restore procedures regularly to verify backup integrity and team readiness
Schedule backups during low-activity periods to minimize performance impact on production systems
anti_patterns: Skipping backup verification immediately after creation without checking completion status
Storing all backup copies on the same storage pool as production virtual machines
Ignoring backup failure alerts without investigating root cause and storage capacity

faq.question: What Proxmox versions are supported by this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Proxmox VE 7.x and 8.x versions when MCP server is properly configured

faq.question: How many backups can this skill manage simultaneously?
faq.answer: No strict limit. Manages all backups defined in your Proxmox storage configuration

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with cloud storage providers?
faq.answer: Direct cloud integration requires additional MCP tools. Backups work with any Proxmox-supported storage backend

faq.question: Is my backup data transmitted outside my infrastructure?
faq.answer: No. All operations stay within your Proxmox environment. No backup data leaves your infrastructure

faq.question: What happens if a backup operation fails?
faq.answer: The skill reports failure details including error codes. Check storage capacity and review Proxmox logs for troubleshooting

faq.question: How does this differ from Proxmox built-in backup?
faq.answer: This skill wraps Proxmox backup tools with natural language interface for easier management and automation workflows
